title: The Dow Is Down 90 Points Because Trade Hope Might Be Fading
text:
Text size

Heading Lower. The three major U.S. stock market indexes fell despite fresh hopes for progress on a U.S.-China trade deal, potentially an indication of fatigue over previous false starts in the talks.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average lost 90 points, or 0.3%. The S&P 500 lost 0.4% and the Nasdaq Composite fell 0.8%.

Midday Movers

Conagra Brands (CAG) rose 5.2% after it reported better than expected earnings but below-consensus revenue.

Whirlpool (WHR) gained 4% after J.P. Morgan upgraded the stock to Overweight from Neutral.

General Motors (GM) was up 1.2% after a report that the company could soon reach a deal with its striking workers.

Beyond Meat (BYND) rose 7.6% after McDonald’s said it was testing the company’s plant-based burgers.

Carnival (CCL) dropped 8.1% after the world’s largest cruise operator cut its full-year profit guidance, citing weather-related disruptions like Hurricane Dorian and higher fuel costs over Middle East tensions.

Write to Ben Walsh at ben.walsh@barrons.com
description: The three major U.S. stock market indexes fell despite fresh hopes for progress on a U.S.-China trade deal, potentially an indication of fatigue over previous false starts in the talks.
